channel.title: Player Save
channel.description:
[shadow=red,left][/shadow]Ok so i have recently added 3 achievements, was trying to get them to save correctly but i get these errors in run.bat
[code] f range: 14 [3/19/12 6:54 AM]: at java.lang.String.getChars(String.java:858) [3/19/12 6:54 AM]: at java.io.BufferedWriter.write(BufferedWriter.java:226)

[/code] And this is my charwright lines for it [code]
characterfile.write("armourNewb = ", 0, 14); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.armourNewb), 0, Integer.toString(p.armourNewb).length()); characterfile.newLine();
characterfile.write("irony = ", 0, 14); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.irony), 0, Integer.toString(p.irony).length()); characterfile.newLine(); [/code] [code] } else if (token.equals("irony")) { p.irony = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("armourNewb")) { p.armourNewb = Integer.parseInt(token2); [/code] What the error does is it completely clears your char file , what do i do :confused:
also it shows up in playersave like this?!?! [code] irony0 armou0 [/code]

item.title: Player Save
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

Same error as on another thread.

characterfile.write("armourNewb = ", 0, 14);
characterfile.write("irony = ", 0, 14);

Look at the number in red. Also, please, for future references use easier to comprehend conventions.

Read full topic

item.title: Player Save
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Hmm… you’ll need to ask someone who is more familiar with Java than myself.

Sorry I couldn’t help.

Read full topic

item.title: Player Save
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

Ruby Forums Coder:

Did you change any of the imports?

no o_0

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:

Did you change any of the imports?
